sect1.title: Auth Module
sect1.para: There are several agent authentication modules (DB, LDAP and HTTPBasicAuth) which comes with the OTRS framework. It's also possible to develop your own authentication modules. The agent authentication modules are located under Kernel/System/Auth/*.pm. To configure it see the admin manual. An example of a simple agent auth module. Save it under Kernel/System/Auth/Simple.pm. You just need 3 functions, new(), GetOption() and Auth() return the uid, then the authentication is ok.
Format:

sect1.title: Navigation Module
sect1.para: Over this module layer you can create dynamicaly navigation bar items with dynamic content (Name and Description).
Format:
To use this module, add the following to the Kernel/Config.pm and restart your webserver (if you use mod_perl)

sect1.title: Frontend Module
sect1.para: Frontend Modules are located under "$OTRS_HOME/Kernel/Modules/*.pm". There are two public functions in there. new() and Run() which are used from the Frontend Handle (e. g. index.pl). "new()" is used to create an Frontend Module object. The Frontend Handle gives basic framework object to the Frontend Module. For example ParamObject (to get formular params), DBObject (to use existing database connects), LayoutObject (to use templates and other html layout functions), ConfigObject (to access config settings), LogObject (to use the framework log system), UserObject (to get the user functions from the current user), GroupObject (to get the group functions).
For more info about core modules see http://dev.otrs.org/
Format:

You also need a module registration for Frontend Modules to use it. Define read only groups with the 'GroupRo' and read write groups with 'Group' param (see table below for details). You also can define navigation bar icons via the 'NavBar' param (see table below for details).
You can access this Frontend Module via http (browse) with the Action param = Module or over the navigation bar.
Description of Frontend::Module options:

row.entry: An ARRAY reference of rw groups of this module.
An ARRAY reference of ro groups of this module.
Modul description, just for internal, not shown in the user interface.
NavBar context name of this module.

sect1.para: Description of NavBar (icon points) options:

row.entry: The description of the icon which is shown in the navbar after leaving the mouse over.
The icon name shown in the navbar.
The icon image shown in the navbar.
The Link behind the icon in the navbar.
Just shown this icon in this NavBar context.
Sort prio of the icon in the navbar.

sect1.title: Core Module
sect1.para: Core modules are located under $OTRS_HOME/Kernel/System/*. This layer is for the logical work. These modules are to handle system routines like "lock ticket" and "create ticket". These modules need always pod (Perl Documentation).
A few common core modules are: Log (Kernel::System::Log); Ticket (Kernel::System::Ticket), Auth (Kernel::System::Auth), User (Kernel::System::User), Email (Kernel::System::Email).
For more info of this core modules see http://dev.otrs.org
Format:

sect1.title: Customer Auth Module
sect1.para: It's the same as "Agent Auth Modules" but the module location is Kernel/System/CustomerAuth/*.pm.

sect1.title: Customer User Module
sect1.para: With this module layer you can have a bridge between your customer source system and OTRS. So it's possible to use your customer data directly for your data ware house (read only and read write).
Format:
To use this module, see the admin manual.

sect1.title: Customer Navigation Module
sect1.para: Over this module layer you can create dynamically navigation bar items with dynamic content (Name and Description).
The Format is the same as the Navigation Module.
Just the config setting key is different. To use this module, add the following to the Kernel/Config.pm and restart your webserver (if you use mod_perl).

sect1.title: Stats Modul
sect1.para: A stats module is easy, you just need two functions. Param() to get all useable params for the stats and Run() to return the stats result.
Kernel/Config.pm:
Kernel/System/Stats/SomeExampleStats.pm:

sect2.title: Ticket Number Module
sect2.para: If you want to create a own ticket number format, just create a own ticket number module. The modules are located under "Kernel/System/Ticket/Number/*.pm". For default modules see the admin manual. You just need 2 functions, CreateTicketNr() and GetTNByString():

sect2.title: Ticket PostMaster Module
sect2.para: PostMaster modules are used if an email arrives the PostMaster process. There are two kinds of PostMaster modules. PostMasterPre (used after parsing an email) and PostMasterPost (used after an email is processed and in the database) modules.

If you want to create an own postmaster filter, just create an own module. The modules are located under "Kernel/System/PostMaster/Filter/*.pm". For default modules see the admin manual. You just need two functions, new() and Run():
The following is an example module to match emails and set X-OTRS-Headers (see doc/X-OTRS-Headers.txt for more infos).

sect2.title: Weitere Module
sect2.para: Die Agent Ticket Permission Modules (Kernel/System/Ticket/Permission/) beinhalten Funktionen zum Prüfen von Zugriffsberechtigungen eines Agent auf ein Ticket.
Die Customer Ticket Permission Modules (Kernel/System/Ticket/CustomerPermission/) beinhalten Funktionen zum Prüfen von Zugriffsberechtigungen eines Kunden auf ein Ticket.
Mit dem Article Modul (Kernel/System/Ticket/Article.pm) können Articel von Tickets ausgelesen und erstellt werden.
Weitere Module mit Beschreibung finden Sie unter http://dev.otrs.org/
